title: Free body diagram of suspended sphere

content.question: The figure shows a sphere of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with net charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is connected to an insulating thread. The sphere is suspended at rest between two oppositely charged parallel plates. Which of the following shows a correct free body diagram for the forces acting on the sphere?

choices.label: The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. An arrow labeled F sub E points horizontally to the right, and arrow labeled m g points vertically downward, and a longer arrow labeled T points diagonally downward and to the right, bisecting the area created by arrows F sub E and m g.

The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. An arrow labeled m g points vertically upward. An arrow labeled F sub E points horizontally to the left, and a longer arrow labeled T points diagonally upward and to the left, bisecting the area created by arrows mg and F sub E.

The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. An arrow labeled m g points vertically upward. An arrow labeled F sub E points horizontally to the left, and a longer arrow labeled T points downward and to the right.

The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. An arrow labeled F sub E points horizontally to the right. An arrow labeled m g points vertically downward, and a longer arrow labeled T points upward and to the left.

content.answer: The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. An arrow labeled F sub E points horizontally to the right. An arrow labeled m g points vertically downward, and a longer arrow labeled T points upward and to the left.
